image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference

props.synopsis: The RBA announces it will keep the cash rate steady, with all eyes on where to for rates for the rest of the year. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Rates on hold 'not the outcome homeowners wanted', Chalmers says

image.altText: Michele Bullock stands behind podium with microphones, with RBA logos behind her

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold at 3.6 per cent, having cut them at its previous meeting in August.

title.children: Breaking: RBA holds rates but 'economy hardly firing on all cylinders'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese welcomes US President Donald Trump's proposal to end Israel's war on Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese urges 'all parties' to engage with Trump's Gaza plan

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM welcomes Trump's 20-point plan to end Israel's war on Gaza
'People make mistakes': Triple-0 outage not about lack of investment, Optus board says
Singtel, Optus address calls for Stephen Rue to step aside

image.altText: Two older men in suits shake hands.

props.synopsis: For all US President Donald Trump's boasts about ending wars and being a worthy candidate for a Nobel Peace Prize, he has failed to end the war in Gaza and build a sustainable future for both Israelis and Palestinians. At least for now.

title.children: Benjamin Netanyahu has outmanoeuvred yet another American president

image.altText: Anika Wells in white.

props.synopsis: Communications Minister Anika Wells has instructed Optus to bring in an "independent and external party" during a meeting with the heads of the embattled telco and its Singaporean parent company, Singtel.

title.children: Optus instructed to find 'external party' to review systems after triple-0 outages

image.altText: PNAU performing at the Amphitheatre at Splendour In The Grass 2018

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman subjected to an unlawful strip search at a music festival has been awarded $93,000 in damages, in a judgement that could see thousands of others also receive compensation.

title.children: Woman awarded $93,000 in damages after 'humiliating' festival strip search

image.altText: Bailey Smith and Harris Andrews clash in the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Geelong forged years of goodwill via its accessibility to Mad Monday — now the club faces a mess that it never saw coming.

title.children: How two Instagram posts have unravelled years of goodwill at Geelong's Mad Monday

image.altText: A smiling Kerry Stokes in headshot in a dark conference room

props.synopsis: Media magnate Kerry Stokes will stand down as chair of Seven West Media after the company announced plans to merge with Southern Cross Media.

title.children: Kerry Stokes to stand down as Seven West Media chair amid merger

image.altText: A large black gate at the front of a house with police tape hanging from it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the sudden deaths of a mother and daughter whose bodies were found at a property in Kenmore Hills in Brisbane.

title.children: Crime scene declared after mother and daughter found dead at Airbnb

image.altText: A man looks at the YouTube website on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump sued parent company Alphabet and other social media companies after the platforms suspended his accounts in 2021.

title.children: YouTube to pay Trump $33.46m following Jan 6 Capitol riots ban

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The new Bass Strait ferries have both been completed but new works are needed after an issue with the vessels' hull specifications was detected.

title.children: New Spirit of Tasmania vessels need hull upgrades in case of 'extreme' weather

image.altText: A photo of a street poster of Ayatollah Khomeini.

props.synopsis: For 12 days in June, the world watched as Iran and Israel traded blows. What came next was a brutal purge of spies and traitors.

title.children: Iran was stunned by Israel's spy infiltration. Now it's exacting its revenge

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing and white beard and long hair wearing a beanie outside while it snows

props.synopsis: Donald Day Jr had been in regular online contact with Gareth and Stacey Train before they shot two police officers and a neighbour in December 2022.

title.children: US conspiracy theorist connected to Wieambilla killers strikes plea deal

image.altText: A beam of light extends from a lens atop a canvas canopy.

props.synopsis: A Canberra-made laser is about to become NATO's newest frontline defence against enemy drones, in a deal experts say could transform the future of warfare.

title.children: Australian-made Star Wars-style lasers are helping NATO tackle drone threats

image.altText: An emergency sign at the front of the Caboolture Hospital.

props.synopsis: Queensland's premier has called for an independent investigation into the problem, affecting up to 9,000 patients at Caboolture Hospital dating back to April 2023.

title.children: Delay in scan results showing patient had advanced cancer triggers major review

image.altText: School grounds from a street with sign in brick fence that says St Augustine's College - Sydney

props.synopsis: Police will allege the 24-year-old engaged in an "inappropriate relationship" with a 15-year-old boy in her care.

title.children: Female teacher charged over 'inappropriate relationship' with boy

image.altText: A five-year-old girl of South Asian background with pig tails pointing to a card held by a preschool educator.

props.synopsis: Despite the government wanting its Thriving Kids program for children with "mild to moderate" developmental delay and autism to start next year, the system is yet to be designed.

title.children: How will the NDIS alternative for some autistic kids work?

image.altText: Bad Bunny wearing a straw hat and brown suit, one hand on hat.

props.synopsis: Grammy-award winning rapper and singer Bad Bunny receives mixed reactions to the news he will headline the 2026 Super Bowl half-time show.

title.children: Who is Bad Bunny and why are critics upset he's headlining the Super Bowl?

image.altText: A teenage boy being held by police officers on each arm being led to a divvy van.

props.synopsis: Police have charged two 16 and 17-year-old boys in relation to a dangerous incident involving an allegedly stolen car being driven into the pedestrian-only Bourke Street Mall.

title.children: Boys charged over brazen Bourke Street Mall incident

image.altText: James Turner celebrates with Australian flag raised behind his head.

props.synopsis: Paralympic champion James Turner wins Australia's first gold medal of the World Para Athletics Championships, saluting in the 400m T36 event in Delhi.

title.children: Turner wins first Aussie gold at World Para Athletics Championships

image.altText: NRL player James Tedesco passes the ball to his left during a match

props.synopsis: Former Kangaroos captain James Tedesco has informed the Australian Rugby League that he will not be available for the upcoming Ashes series in England.

title.children: Tedesco pulls out of Kangaroos squad to be best man at brother's wedding

image.altText: A nurse writes out a script.

props.synopsis: Qualified registered nurses will soon be able to write prescriptions for medications, in a bid to ease pressure on a stressed public healthcare system.

title.children: Can't get a GP appointment? A nurse could soon prescribe for you

image.altText: Close up of Charlotte robot the World-First Robot for Lunar and Earth Construction

props.synopsis: Developers of a speedy, "spider-like" robot named Charlotte believe it could be building homes on Earth within years, and eventually further lunar exploration.

title.children: Robot that works at 'speed of 100 bricklayers' could soon be building homes

image.altText: A close up photo of a man in a green jumper staring down the camera. He is accompanied by police officers.

props.synopsis: Michael Gauci, who was accused of setting a neighbour on fire after arguing over loud music, has been found not guilty of attempted murder.

title.children: Werribee man found not guilty of deliberately setting neighbour on fire

image.altText: A smiling young woman with dark hair wears a striped shirt as she takes a selfie.

props.synopsis: Lily Ridgeway, 27, has been found not guilty of manslaughter over the 2020 death of Jason Adams in the NSW Hunter Valley.

title.children: Young woman found not guilty over fatal stabbing of friend's partner

image.altText: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell stands looking down with his cap on backwards during a T20 international.

props.synopsis: A brutal run of injuries continues for one of Australia's top white-ball cricketers, who is out of the T20 series against New Zealand.

title.children: Glenn Maxwell out of T20 series against NZ after mishap in nets

image.altText: A woman and elderly man sitting at a table with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: A class action on behalf of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people alleges a Commonwealth Work for the Dole scheme was tougher on remote participants than on jobseekers in cities.

title.children: Class action against Work for the Dole alleges racial discrimination

image.altText: Close up of a stick of salami being sliced on a chopping board.

props.synopsis: Producers and retailers say there are more ways to cook goat than just in curry, but so far consumers have shown little interest.

title.children: Australia is the world's biggest goat exporter — so why don't we eat it?

image.altText: A submarine sailing through the water, with an American flag flying from the top.

props.synopsis: The agency responsible for delivering AUKUS has spent five times what it first planned for consultants to review its operations.

title.children: Submarine agency's consultancy bill five times larger than planned

image.altText: A close up shot of a brown and tan dachshund / sausage dog, with big eyes looking directly into camera.

props.synopsis: The rescue effort, which took six hours, rallied the community, with a local plumber and NT Fire and Rescue Service members providing vital help.

title.children: Locals rally to save dachshund stuck down rabbit hole in six-hour mission

image.altText: A group of workers in high-vis walking across scaffolding at a gas plant.

props.synopsis: The federal environment minister was advised pollution from Woodside's Karratha Gas Plant may be causing irreversible changes to ancient rock art, before granting the company a 40-year extension with strict conditions.

title.children: Minister knew of rock art threat before approving Woodside gas plant extension

image.altText: A pile of junk food and snacks

props.synopsis: UNICEF says more children are now overweight and under-nourished than too thin, stirring fresh calls by health experts and farming bodies to tax ultra-processed food producers.

title.children: Finding of more obese yet malnourished kids reignites junk food debate

image.altText: A female pensioner holding her open purse in her hands.

props.synopsis: Women's super balances are disproportionately impacted by events later in life, in addition to childcare duties, which could mean serious financial problems, research from Super Members Council (SMC) has found.

title.children: Older Australian women could retire in poverty, new report says

image.altText: A Taliban flag being held by two men.

props.synopsis: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan have imposed a nationwide shutdown of communications, weeks after they began severing fibre optic connections.

title.children: Taliban imposes communication shutdown in Afghanistan to prevent 'vice'

image.altText: CCTV shows a car being set a light on a back street

props.synopsis: Police have released footage showing the moment a gunman fired on a suburban Sydney home in July, with investigations into the matter continuing.

title.children: Video shows drive-by shooting on Sydney home linked to drug dealers
